intro: Siler alpinum, commonly known as alpine siler, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Siler alpinum is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia, where it contributes to the unique flora of these ecosystems.
